Check out Loopd for Android in the Google Play store. Test your word building skills as the letters snake by. How many words can you build???
The idea is to score as many points as you possibly can by building words (the longer the better) before the countdown is completed.

To start the game, just tap the Start button. That kicks off the 5 minute countdown timer. The three words will be preset for you with letters or word fragments. Your job is to determine what words can be formed from each fragment using the letter tiles from the hopper that are scrolling by in the bottom area.

The top row of the scrolling hopper is used for Word 1. The middle row is used for Word 2. The bottom row is used for Word 3. As you tap letter tiles in the scrolling hopper, those letters are added to the left-most empty tile of the particular word for the row the tapped tile belonged to.
If you make a mistake and want to remove a letter from a word, just tap that letter\'s tile and it will be removed - except for the preset letters in the word fragment which cannot be changed.
No formal words or hyphenated words are allowed. Words can be from 2 to 10 letters long.

After you build a word (for example, Word 1), just tap the "Play" button at the bottom corresponding to that word (in our example, tap the "Play Word 1" button). A specific word can only be played once per game.

Remember to tap the letters in the scrolling hopper to add them to the played word. Don\'t drag them, it does not work. The game was built for pure finger-tapping speed. Letters can ony be used once per \'row scroll\' but after that they can be used again.
102 letters are added to the hopper, shuffled, and continuously scroll around 3 rows. The mix of the 102 letters is as follows:

Scoring is simple and mostly based on the length of the played word. Letters 1 - 3 of a word are worth 1 point each. Letters 4 - 6 are worth 3 points each. Letters 7 - 9 are worth 5 points each. Letter 10 is worth 10 points.

So, for example, if you played the word KNUCKLES, it would be worth 22 points. 1 point each for "K", "N", and "U". Then 3 points each for "C", "K", and "L". Finally, "E" and "S", being letters 7 and 8, would be worth 5 points each.
By contrast, the word "FLY", which only contains letters 1, 2, and 3, is only worth 3 points. As you can see, the longer the word, the more points you will earn for a particular word.
In addition, if there are blank tiles to the left of the preset tiles, you\'ll earn 2 points for each of them if you play that particular word.

Also, an occasional Bonus +10 tile will scroll across among the other tiles. If you are able to use the bonus letter in a word, 10 points is added to the word. In fact, if you get really lucky and can use more than one bonus letter in a word, 10 points is added to the word for each bonus letter used.
For example, in the "FLY" example above, if the "Y" had been from a Bonus +10 tile, the word would have been worth 13 points as opposed to 3.
Finally, the points from each word played are added together to arrive at the score for the game.

Tap START to begin the game. Tap (don\'t drag) the letters in your tray to form a word. Tap the PLAY button when you have created your word. Do this as many times as you can...but do it quickly!\n\nRemember, you\'re racing the clock AND your opponent!
